MINUTE 4.Confidential Annex.(3rd March, 1941 - 5.0 p.m. )MR. MENZIES suggested that the Chiefs of staffs should he asked to prepare a further appreciation,showing the effects of recent developments in the Balkanstogether with information as to the attitude of turkey and Yugoslavia on the Military policy decided upon atrecent War Cahinet Meetings. While he fully agreed inprinciple with the recent decisions, he was anxious about the timing of our policy, and he would wish to feel that this aspect of the matter had been t aken intoaccount "by the Chiefs of Staffs.THE FIRST SEA LORD said that for the last two days the Chiefs of Staffs had been engaged in working out an estimate of the time that it would take the german forces to reach the line in Greece which it had "beendecided to hold; and they hoped to reach a final conclusion on this point within the next two hours0Thereafter, they proposed to s end a telegram to the commanders in the Middle East asking them to comment on this estimate in the light of their knowledge of localconditions and of the Greek plans; to advise us whetherthe Allied forces could reach their positions in Greecein time to hold up the German advance; and generally to furnish us with their appreciation of the whole situation, with particular reference to the time factor.Great George Street, S.W.1,TO BE KET UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested tuai special care may be taken u-,ensure the secrecy of this document.
